title: Blind man fighting for life after falling onto train tracks with guide dog
text:

A blind man has sustained life-threatening injuries after falling on to subway tracks in Glasgow.

Reports say the 32-year-old man was with his guide dog when he plunged about 6ft onto the line at Bridge Street Station shortly before noon on Thursday.

Metro reports his golden Labrador also fell but managed to jump back up onto the platform.

He was taken to the city's Queen Elizabeth University Hospital for treatment.

The dog is said to be "distressed" but unhurt and now being looked after by Guide Dogs UK while his owner remains in hospital.

British Transport Police said officers were called to the station following reports of a incident on the tracks.

In a statement, the force said: "Paramedics also attended, and a 32-year-old man has been taken to hospital.

"At this stage his injuries are believed to be life-threatening. The incident is not being treated as suspicious."

Metro reported the Scottish SPCA collected a "very distressed" but otherwise healthy guide dog, which had been taken into the care of Guide Dogs UK.

A Guide Dogs UK spokesman said the organisation was looking into the incident.

"Our immediate thoughts and concerns are for the welfare of our guide dog owner and their guide dog.

"Members of Guide Dogs staff have been supporting the dog owner’s family in hospital and the dog is being examined by a vet before being taken into Guide Dogs’ care for the short-term."
description: Man, 32, plunged 6ft onto line at Bridge Street Station in Glasgow with his golden Labrador jumped back on to platform
